episodeTitle: The Escapee Team in Trouble! The Forbidden Move: Venom Demon!
episodeTitleJapanese: 脱獄チーム絶体絶命 禁じ手"毒の巨兵（ベノムデーモン）"
description: As Luffy and his allies attempt to escape Impel Down, they face their greatest challenge yet. Magellan unleashes his ultimate technique, Venom Demon: Jigoku no Shinpan, a forbidden poison attack so powerful it threatens to destroy the entire prison. With their backs against the wall, Ivankov uses his Hell Wink to launch the escapees through the prison entrance, where Jinbe's summoned whale sharks carry them to safety on a captured Marine vessel.

events.title: Marine Vessel Secured for Escape
events.description: Jinbe, Crocodile, and Daz Bonez successfully secure a Marine battleship in the bay outside Impel Down, establishing their getaway vessel for the mass prison break.
events.significance: Provides the critical escape route for Luffy and the other prisoners fleeing Impel Down, setting the stage for the climactic escape sequence.

events.title: Champion Gatling Debut
events.description: Luffy, wearing wax armor created by Galdino, unleashes Champion Gatling against Magellan. The wax coating allows him to strike without being poisoned, breaking through Magellan's Hydra attack with ease.
events.significance: Demonstrates the tactical cooperation between Luffy and former enemy Galdino, showing how the prison break has united unlikely allies against a common threat.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy attacks Magellan with wax-coated fists

events.title: Champion Stamp Attack Fails
events.description: Luffy attempts a Champion Stamp attack against Magellan, but the wax armor begins to melt and wilt under Magellan's more potent poison. Galdino is forced to remove the wax from Luffy to prevent him from being poisoned.
events.significance: Foreshadows Magellan's ultimate technique and demonstrates that even Galdino's wax has limits against the Warden's overwhelming poison powers.

events.title: Venom Demon: Jigoku no Shinpan Unleashed
events.description: Magellan transforms himself with crimson-red poison and unleashes his ultimate forbidden technique, Venom Demon: Jigoku no Shinpan (Hell's Judgment). He creates a massive devil-like entity made of extremely toxic poison that mimics his movements, with poison so potent it can melt through anything, even Galdino's wax.
events.significance: Reveals Magellan's ultimate power and establishes the Doku Doku no Mi's true terrifying capabilities. The technique is so dangerous it threatens to destroy all of Impel Down and forces the escapees to abandon any thought of fighting.

quotes.text: This poison can destroy all of Impel Down!
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Warning about the destructive power of his ultimate attack

events.title: Retreat From Magellan
events.description: Realizing they cannot defeat Magellan's Venom Demon, Luffy orders a full retreat. The poison spreads rapidly across walls and floors like a disease, forcing all the escapees to flee toward the prison entrance with Magellan in pursuit.
events.significance: Marks one of the few times Luffy recognizes he must flee rather than fight, showing tactical growth. The chase sequence builds tension as the escapees race against time and poison.

events.title: Ivankov's Partial Recovery
events.description: Emporio Ivankov, who had been severely weakened from healing Luffy's poison earlier, partially recovers using his Horu Horu no Mi abilities. He bursts through the ground alongside Inazuma, ready to assist in the escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Horu Horu no Mi's healing capabilities and sets up Ivankov's crucial role in the final escape. His recovery at this critical moment proves decisive.

events.title: Hell Wink Escape Launch
events.description: Ivankov enlarges his head massively and has all the prisoners cling to it. He then unleashes his Hell Wink technique, creating a powerful shockwave that propels everyone out through the entrance of Impel Down and over the ocean, seconds before Magellan's poison can reach them.
events.significance: The Hell Wink becomes the key to the successful prison break, allowing dozens of prisoners to escape the inescapable Impel Down. This moment represents the culmination of Luffy's rescue mission.

quotes.text: Everyone, grab onto my face! Hell Wink!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov launches the prisoners out of Impel Down

events.title: Whale Sharks Summoned by Jinbe
events.description: As the prisoners are launched into the air by Ivankov's Hell Wink, they land on a school of whale sharks that Jinbe had summoned into the Calm Belt. The whale sharks carry them safely across the water to the captured Marine battleship.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's incredible abilities as a Fish-Man and his mastery over sea creatures. The whale sharks prove essential to completing the escape, bridging the gap between Impel Down and the ship.

events.title: Successful Breakout from Impel Down
events.description: Luffy and the escaped prisoners successfully reach the Marine battleship and break out of Impel Down. Magellan arrives at the entrance seconds too late, staring in disbelief as the ship moves away. This marks the first and only mass breakout in Impel Down's history.
events.significance: A watershed moment in One Piece history - the 'inescapable' Impel Down has been breached. This mass breakout severely damages the World Government's reputation and sets up major consequences for the coming war. Multiple dangerous criminals are now free.

quotes.text: This poison can destroy all of Impel Down!
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Warning about the destructive power of Venom Demon

quotes.text: Everyone, grab onto my face! Hell Wink!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Launching the prisoners out of Impel Down to freedom

themes.description: The episode showcases Luffy's growth as he recognizes when to fight and when to flee, prioritizing the mission over his pride.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's retreat from Magellan symbolizes maturity - knowing that saving Ace requires survival, not pointless battles.

themes.description: Former enemies like Crocodile, Galdino, and Buggy work together with Luffy for mutual survival, showing how desperate circumstances create strange partnerships.
themes.symbolism: The cooperation between pirates of different crews represents the breakdown of normal hierarchies in the face of overwhelming authority.

themes.description: Despite overwhelming odds and Magellan's terrifying power, the prisoners' collective will to escape drives them to succeed against impossible opposition.
themes.symbolism: The successful escape from the 'inescapable' prison represents the triumph of human will over institutional control.

culturalReferences.description: Impel Down's structure mirrors the circles of hell from Dante's Divine Comedy, with the escape representing a journey from hell to freedom

characterSpotlights.development: Magellan reveals his ultimate power, Venom Demon, demonstrating why he is considered one of the most dangerous individuals in the One Piece world. His failure to stop the escape will haunt him.
keyActions: Unleashes Venom Demon: Jigoku no Shinpan
Nearly succeeds in stopping the breakout
Arrives seconds too late to prevent the escape
quotes: This poison can destroy all of Impel Down!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being severely weakened, Ivankov rises to the occasion at the critical moment, using his Hell Wink to save everyone and make the escape possible.
keyActions: Bursts through the ground with Inazuma
Enlarges his head for prisoners to hold onto
Uses Hell Wink to launch everyone out of Impel Down
quotes: Everyone, grab onto my face! Hell Wink!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates tactical maturity by recognizing when retreat is necessary, coordinating with allies like Galdino, and trusting his companions to execute the escape plan.
keyActions: Uses Champion Gatling with Galdino's wax armor
Recognizes the need to retreat from Venom Demon
Wakes Ivankov for the critical escape

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe's mastery over sea creatures proves invaluable, showing his unique abilities as a Fish-Man and establishing him as a crucial ally for the mission ahead.
keyActions: Summons whale sharks into the Calm Belt
Ensures safe passage to the ship

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Luffy and Magellan, adding more action choreography and expanding the Champion Gatling and Champion Stamp scenes.
Additional reaction shots of various prisoners and guards during the Venom Demon reveal were added for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: Episode 450 aired on May 9, 2010, achieving a TV rating of 12.5% and ranking #2 in its timeslot.
The Venom Demon technique's name in Japanese, 'Benomu Dēmon: Jigoku no Shinpan', literally translates to 'Venom Demon: Hell's Judgment', referencing Impel Down's theme of divine punishment.
This episode marks the first and only successful mass breakout in Impel Down's history, with over 200 prisoners escaping.

sources.title: Impel Down Great Escape Incident - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Katsuhisa Hōki, Jinbe's voice actor in this episode, had taken over the role from Daisuke Gōri starting from episode 440, as Gōri had passed away in January 2010.
The episode adapts portions of manga Chapters 546 (pages 16-17) and 547 (pages 2-19).
Impel Down's design and multi-level structure was heavily inspired by Dante's Inferno, with each level representing a different circle of hell.

sources.title: Dante's Inferno Inspirations In One Piece: Impel Down Arc
